cause.description:
Angel View Crippled Children's Foundation is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization serving physically and developmentally challenged children and young adults with 24-hour nursing and habilitative care in a residential setting.
Angel View operates 17 six-bed residential homes serving more than 100 children and young adults in locations throughout the Coachella Valley and High Desert. Our homes help young people with special needs and developmental disabilities reach their full potential by developing the necessary skills for independence and self-esteem.
WWW.ANGELVIEW.ORG
This is an amazing organization I have been involved with for many years. The residents of the Angel View homes are constantly smiling and happy despite the fact that they might not be able to walk, speak, or live a "normal" lifestyle. My friends and I have enjoyed spending time with the residents of these facilities and have created close relationships with them. Volunteers are always welcome and hours can be done by just chatting, playing board games, watching TV, and by just being a friend. Let these inspirational kids make a difference in your life!
1. Disabled young adults deserve the right to learn to live independent stable lives.
cause.mission: Help Developmentally Disabled Young People Learn New Skills to the "Road of Independence."
